summary:
The Nintendo DS (or NDS) is a popular handheld gaming console with two screens, released in 2004-2005. It has a unique design with a foldable case, a touchscreen, and a microphone. You can play games and connect with other DS consoles nearby or online. It's part of Nintendo's "third pillar" strategy, eventually replacing the Game Boy series.

Nintendo released updated versions like the DS Lite (lighter and brighter) and DSi (with new features but less backward compatibility). These consoles sold very well, making the DS the best-selling handheld gaming device. It was followed by the Nintendo 3DS in 2011.
title: Nintendo DS
